name: Harriet Chalmers Adams
achievement/s: Explored and photographed South America, Asia, South Pacific

name: Gertrude Sanford Legendre
achievement/s: American socialite who was a noted explorer and big-game hunter. She contributed rare specimens from Africa, Iran, Southeast Asia, Canada, and Alaska to natural history museums.

name: Tania Aebi
achievement/s: Held the record as the youngest person and first American woman to sail solo around the world (with stops and assistance).

name: Florence Augusta Merriam Bailey
achievement/s: American ornithologist and nature writer, who conducted extensive field work in the American West

name: Ann Bancroft
achievement/s: First woman to travel over the ice cap to the North and South Poles

name: Carol Beckwith
achievement/s: Photographer, author, and filmmaker known for documenting the tribal cultures of Africa, most notably in partnership with Australian photographer Angela Fisher.

name: Nellie Bly
achievement/s: Pioneering journalist who travelled around the world in 72 days, the first person to do so.

name: Louise Arner Boyd
achievement/s: Explored Greenland and the Arctic

name: Susan Butcher
achievement/s: Dog musher in Alaska

name: Calamity Jane
achievement/s: American frontierswoman and professional scout, known for her claim of being an acquaintance of Wild Bill Hickok and for fighting Indians.

name: Aimée Crocker
achievement/s: Heiress, writer spent a decade exploring the Far East in the 1890s. Toured the interior of Java and Borneo.

name: Sophia Danenberg
achievement/s: First black woman to reach summit of Mount Everest

name: Cassandra DePecol
achievement/s: Set the fastest time to visit all sovereign countries

name: Nancy Bird-Walton
achievement/s: Australian aviation pioneer

name: Kay Cottee
achievement/s: First woman to sail solo, non-stop around the world

name: Robyn Davidson
achievement/s: 1700 mile camel trek from Alice Springs to the west coast of Australia

name: Berthe Cabra
achievement/s: Belgian traveller, first European woman to travel across central Africa from East to West.

name: Renata Chlumska
achievement/s: Climbed Mount Everest, kayaked and bicycled around lower 48 states of USA

name: Isabella Bird
achievement/s:
Explorer, writer and naturalist who travelled by herself through 
North America, Hawaii, Japan, Korea, China, Vietnam, Singapore, Malaysia, India, Persia, Kurdistan, Turkey, and Morocco.

name: Gertrude Bell
achievement/s: Explored and mapped Greater Syria, Mesopotamia, Asia Minor, Arabia

name: Laura Bingham
achievement/s: Executed expedition to cross continent of South America with no money.

name: Laura Dekker
achievement/s: Youngest person to sail around world solo

name: Dominick Arduin
achievement/s: Disappeared on her attempt to become the first woman to ski alone to the North Pole

name: Jeanne Baré
achievement/s: First woman (disguised as a man) to circumnavigate the world

name: Octavie Coudreau
achievement/s: Early explorer and geographer of the Amazon region in Brazil and French Guiana

name: Alexandra David-Néel
achievement/s: Travelled to Tibet while closed to foreigners

name: Jean Batten
achievement/s: First person to fly between England and New Zealand solo - broke other records

name: Krystyna Chojnowska-Liskiewicz
achievement/s: First woman to sail solo around the world

name: Eva Dickson
achievement/s: Swedish explorer, aviator, travel writer and rally driver. The first woman to have crossed the Sahara by car.

name: Lady Hay Drummond-Hay
achievement/s: First woman to circumnavigate the world by air (by Zeppelin)

name: Edith Durham
achievement/s: Explored Albania and the Balkans

name: Amelia Earhart
achievement/s: First woman to fly solo across Atlantic

name: Isabelle Eberhardt
achievement/s: Swiss explorer and writer in Algeria, who converted to Islam and traveled freely dressed as a man.

name: Gertrude Ederle
achievement/s: First woman to swim English Channel

name: Enid Gordon-Gallien
achievement/s: Explored and mapped Kalambo Falls

name: Barbara Hillary
achievement/s: First African American woman to reach North Pole

name: Amy Johnson
achievement/s: Pioneering aviator who set long-distance flying records

name: Osa Johnson
achievement/s: Made films of and wrote books about travels in Africa, South Pacific, Borneo

name: Mary Kingsley
achievement/s: Ethnographer and explorer of West Africa

name: Belinda Kirk
achievement/s: Founder of Explorers Connect. Kirk has travelled across Africa, Nicaragua, and the Chinese Taklamakan Desert. She captained the first all-female rowing team to circumnavigate Britain non-stop.

name: Ness Knight
achievement/s: Explorer and first female in history to swim the Thames River from source to London in 2013. Completed a solo traverse of remote regions of Northern Namibia in 2016.

name: Annie "Londonderry" Kopchovsky
achievement/s: First woman to bicycle around the world

name: Charlotte Mansfield
achievement/s: Wrote ''Via Rhodesia'' (1911) about her travels in Southern Africa

name: Beryl Markham
achievement/s: British-born Kenyan aviator (one of the first bush pilots), adventurer, racehorse trainer and author. She was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic from east to west.

name: Annette Meakin
achievement/s: First Englishwoman to cross the Trans-Siberian Railway. Wrote about this in "The Ribbon of Iron".Travelled in Russian Turkestan and other parts of Russia.

name: Ynes Mexia
achievement/s: Mexican botanist and explorer who started her career at age 55. Discovered one new genus (Mexianthus) and many new species of plants.

name: Dervla Murphy
achievement/s: Irish travel writer known for cycling alone through Europe, Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan to India

name: Sarah Marquis
achievement/s: From 2010 to 2013, she walked 20,000 kilometres (12,000 mi) alone from Siberia to the Gobi Desert, into China, Laos, Thailand, and then across Australia

name: Marianne North
achievement/s: Prolific English Victorian biologist and botanical artist

name: Ida Pfeiffer
achievement/s: Travelled alone around the world in 1847, published books of her numerous travels

name: Dorothy Pine
achievement/s: Possibly first woman to visit all 193 UN-recognised countries

name: Anésia Pinheiro Machado
achievement/s: Second Brazilian licensed female pilot in Brazil

name: Kate Rice
achievement/s: First woman prospector in Northern Canada, writer, and trapper well known for her dog sled abilities

name: Wanda Rutkiewicz
achievement/s: Polish mountain climber, the first woman to successfully summit K2

name: Kira Salak
achievement/s: Travelled in Mali and Papua New Guinea

name: Annemarie Schwarzenbach
achievement/s: Journalist and photographer, travelled to Iran, Afghanistan, Africa

name: Beryl Smeeton
achievement/s: Mountaineer, cruising sailor, overland traveller

name: Annie Smith Peck
achievement/s: First person to climb Mount Nevado Huascarán in the Andes

name: Hester Stanhope
achievement/s: Conducted first modern archaeology in Holy Land; travelled dressed as a man (unveiled)

name: Freya Stark
achievement/s: Travelled within and wrote about the Middle East, including the Arabian deserts, Afghanistan

name: Clärenore Stinnes
achievement/s: First woman to circumnavigate the world by automobile.

name: Rosie Swale-Pope
achievement/s: Has run, walked and sailed around the world

name: Junko Tabei
achievement/s: First woman to reach summit of Mount Everest

name: Annie Edson Taylor
achievement/s: First person to survive a trip over the Niagara Falls in a barrel

name: Gudrid Thorbjarnardóttir
achievement/s: With her husband, led an expedition to North America

name: Alexandrine Tinné
achievement/s: Dutch explorer in Africa and the first European woman to attempt to cross the Sahara

name: Adeline Van Buren
achievement/s: Along with her sister Augusta Van Buren, they were the first women to ride solo motorcycles across the continental US.

name: Augusta Van Buren
achievement/s: Along with her sister Adeline Van Buren, they were the first women to ride solo motorcycles across the continental US.

name: Jessica Watson
achievement/s: Youngest person to sail non-stop and unassisted around the world (but did not fulfil WSSRC criteria)

name: Meagan McGrath
achievement/s: First Canadian (male or female) to ski unassisted to the South Pole.

name: Aloha Wanderwell
achievement/s: First woman to drive around the world

name: Fanny Bullock Workman
achievement/s: American cartographer, explored glaciers in Himalayas
